cab.content: This DMilitary Secret.From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State f&r India,24th March 1920.(Received 25th.)Priority A.m 3867. 24th March. Malleson wires 16th March, repeating Tehran : " Fugitive prisoners of war who left, Askabad gave information which confirmed what has been recently reported regarding conditions generally." Scarcity of food is becoming serious, and rations of troops have been reduced. There are no signs of employment of oil fuel on railways, and it is thought that, beyond reservoir, supplies captured at Cheleken Krasnovodsk, which were imme-diately railed east, no more is available at present owing to the leak of the wells at Cheleken." Troops, recently on Krasnovodsk front, are moving eastward, and west of Askabad there are now comparatively small garrisons."lent !3 X,Vi; I-operty ofWb11338i
